result.execSummary:
The defendant Javier Juarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: To any sentence, with release to the Day Reporting Center ONLY, credit for 0 days time served.
Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid through collection of the probation agent. Any remaining balance upon release of probation shall be due immediately. Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.

No possession of any firearms or ammunition.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any alcohol.

Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol.
Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.
Court ordered defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
No driving without a valid drivers license.
Provide a DNA sample, if not already done.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.
Defendant must attend at least one Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group once per week.

timeConds.notes:
Without good time and a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Condition time shall be imposed as follows:
30 days for the 1st positive drug and alcohol test.
40 days for the 2nd positive drug and alcohol test.
50 days for the 3rd positive drug and alcohol test.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javier Juarez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant re:  DNA surcharges.
Letter from defendant re: DNA surcharges.

DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
(  X) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:  12/12/14

Defendant Javier Juarez in court with attorney John E. Dobogai.  Paul Hauer for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; with release to the Day Reporting Center ONLY; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant must attend at least one Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  treatment or sobriety support group per week. 
- No possession of any alcohol. 
- No possession of any firearms or ammunition.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders. 
- No driving without a valid drivers license. 
- Court orders 120 days of condition time, without good time, and with a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Condition time shall be imposed as follows: 
*30 days for the 1st positive drug and alcohol test.
*40 days for the 2nd positive drug and alcohol test. 
*50 days for the 3rd positive drug and alcohol test. 
- Provide a DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection of the probation agent. Any remaining balance upon release of probation shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Javier Juarez in court with attorney John E. Dobogai.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Final Pretrial.   
AS TO COUNT  1 of the Amended Information -  
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting
Court orders Jury Trial scheduled for 9-23-2014, vacated. 
Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing on 10-03-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Defendant is charged as follows, Count 1: Possession of Cocaine - 2nd and Subsequent Offense, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.41(3g)(c), 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Requested Jury Instructions filed by ADA Danielle Chojnacki.
State's Motion In Limine filed by ADA Danielle Chojnacki.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Witness List filed by ADA Danielle Chojnacki.

Defendant Javier Juarez in court with attorney John E. Dobogai.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, this case is reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the safety building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Javier Juarez in court with attorney John E Dobogai.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Chojnacki).  Plea hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Javier Juarez in court with attorney John E Dobogai.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Chojnacki).  Defendant being assessed for drug treatment court.  Judge will allow one final off-the-record adjournment.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Javier Juarez in court with attorney John E Dobogai.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for Danielle E Chojnacki for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 26.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Javier Juarez in court with attorney John E Dobogai.  Dennis Murphy for Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Javier Juarez in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Jacob D Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4-14-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
